text: To investigate the molecular mechanism of <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated repression of human <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the human <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter was studied and a palindromic binding site for <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was discovered .

text: The GATA-binding site is located 303 bp upstream from the transcription start site ( TSS ) [ 24 ] .
This site is highly conserved between humans , mice , and rats ( Figure S4 ) and may therefore play an important role in <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulation .
The functional relevance of this site was studied using a <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - promoter construct [ 24 ] .

We transfected human primary <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells , in vitro differentiated Th2 cells , and Jurkat cells ( Jurkat cells are known to constitutively express <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 25 , 26 ] ) , and we measured <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity .

The promoter was not active in the <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing cell line Jurkat or in the in vitro-differentiated Th2 cells , whereas the construct was active in the <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells , which express a lower amount of <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 8A ) .

text: Overexpression of <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in naive T cells diminished luciferase activity of the <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter compared with the control vector ( Figure 8B ) .
To further address the function of the GATA3 site , we inserted a site - specific mutation deleting the GATA3-binding site .

This mutation increased luciferase activity by 3-fold in memory <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD45RO <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells , whereas no difference was observed in naive ( <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - ) <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD45RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells , revealing a repressor activity of <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter ( Figure 8C ) .

text: HEK cells were transiently transfected with <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or a control vector , and increasing amounts of lysates were incubated with oligonucleotides containing the GATA3 site of the <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter or a control oligonucleotide with a mutated GATA3 - binding site .

text: To gain insights into the in vivo situation , we performed a chromatin immunoprecipitation ( ChIP ) using an anti - <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody and showed that <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to the <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter region in Th2 cells , but not in iTreg cells ( Figure 7F ) .
